titles.title: Investment Competitiveness Act of 1993
To provide tax treatment for foreign investment through a U.S. Regulated Investment Company comparable to the tax treatment for direct foreign investment and investment through a foreign mutual fund.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1069)
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Select Revenue Measures.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 4/28/1993--Introduced. Investment Competitiveness Act of 1993 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exempt interest-related dividends received from a regulated investment company from the 30 percent tax on the income of nonresident aliens and foreign corporations not connected with U.S. business. Provides exceptions. Provides for determining: (1) taxable-interest dividends; and (2) taxable estate stock of nonresident non-citizens in regulated investment companies. Applies the special rules for real estate investment trusts on the disposition of investment in U.S. real property to regulated investment companies.
